newsitem.title: UK: NWE products - gas oil gains on futures, fuel drop.
newsitem.headline: NWE products - gas oil gains on futures, fuel drop.

text.p: NWE oil products ended mixed on Tuesday with gas oil jumping with gains in the futures market.
Gas oil was boosted by $3.00 on the back of futures, but physical business was slow. Diesel looked strong.
Gasoline ended steady despite a sharp rise in NYMEX unleaded futures and two reported cargoes sold to the States on Monday.
Naphtha closed $1-$2 higher tracking crude oil's gains, but activity was quiet and end-user demand was seen as steady.
Low sulphur fuel oil was further depressed, with swaps falling, one cargo sold into Italy and another going to a trader.
Prices stood at $85/$86 fob. High sulphur lost $1 to stand at $80/$81 fob.
